<|endoftext|>/*
Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
Example
is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == false
is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == false
is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == true
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
bool is_equal_to_sum_even(int n) {
   
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i<=n; i++) {
        sum += i;
        if(sum%2 == 0) {
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}

brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include <stdio.h>
using std;
long long special_factorial(int n) {
    long long fact = 1, bfact = 1;
    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)
   
        fact = fact * i;
        
    for (int i = n; i >= 1; i--)
        bfact = bfact * i;
    return fact * bfact;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return true if the three
sides form a right-angled triangle, false otherwise.
A right-angled triangle is a triangle in which one angle is right angle or 
90 degree.
Example:
right_angle_triangle(3, 4, 5) == true
right_angle_triangle(1, 2, 3) == false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
using std;
bool right_angle_triangle(int a, int b, int c)
{
    if((b - c) > 0)
    {
        if((b - c) == 1)
        {
            return ((b - a) == (c-a));
        }
        else
        {
            if((b - a) == (c-a))
            {
                return ((b - c) == (c-b));
            }
            else
            {
                return ((b - c) == (c-a));
            }
        }
    }
    else
    {
        if((b - a) == (c-a))
        {
            return ((b - c) == (c-b));
        }
        else
        {
            return ((b - a) == (c-a));
        }
    }
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Filter given vector of any python values only for integers
>>> filter_integers({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filter_integers({1, 2, 3, "abc", {}, {}})
{1, 2, 3}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
#include <boost/any.hpp>
#include <list> typedef std :: list < boost :: any > list_any;
using std;
vector < int > filter_integers(list_any values) {
    list_any :: iterator it;
   
    vector < int > result;
    for (it = values.begin(); it!= values.end(); ++it) {
        boost::any & value = *it;
        if (value.type() == typeid(int)) {
            result.push_back(value.cast<int>());
        }
    }
    return result;
}

        boost::any & value = *it;
        if (value.type() == typeid(string)) {
            result.push_back(value.cast<string>());
        }
    }
    return result;
}

#include <string>
#include <boost/any.hpp>
#include <list> typedef std :: list < boost :: any > list_any;
using std;
vector < dict < string, int > > filter_dictionaries(list_any values) {
    list_any :: iterator it;
   
    vector < dict < string, int > > result;
    for (it = values.begin(); it!= values.end(); ++it) {
        boost::any & value = *it;
        if (value.type() == typeid(dict < string, int > )) {
            result.push_back(value.cast<dict < string, int > >());
        }
    }
    return result;
}

/*
Filter given vector of any python values only for sets
>>> filter_sets({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filter_sets({"a", 3.14, 5, "abc", {}, {}})
{5}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
#include <boost/any.hpp>
#include <list> typedef std :: list < boost :: any > list_any;
using std;
vector < set <int> > filter_sets(list_any values) {
    list_any :: iterator it;
   
    vector < set <int> > result;
    for (it = values.begin(); it!= values.end(); ++it) {
        boost::any & value = *it;
        if (value.type() == typeid(set <int>)) {
            result.push_back(value.cast<set <int> >());
        }
    }
    return result;
}

/*
Filter given vector of any python values only for tuples
>>> filter_tuples({"a", 3.14, 5})
{5}
>>> filter_tuples({"a", 3.14, 5, "abc", {}, {}})
{5}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
#include <boost/any.hpp>
#include <list> typedef std :: list < boost :: any > list_any;
using std;
vector < tuple < int, string > > filter_tuples(list_any values) {
    list_any :: iterator it;
   
    vector < tuple < int, string > > result;
    for (it = values.begin(); it!= values.end(); ++it) {
        boost::any & value = *it;
        if (value.type() == typeid(tuple < int, string > )) {
            result.push_back(value.cast<tuple < int, string > >());
        }
    }
    return result;
}

<|endoftext|>#include<stdio.h>

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5

    1.0
    */
double ans = 0;
double value;
value = poly(xs, ans);
while (abs(value) > 1e-6)
 {
    double driv = 0;
    for (int i = 1; i < xs.size(); i++)
    if (_i_6 > _i_6) {
        ans = ans - value / driv;
        }
     {
       
        ans = ans + value / driv;
    }
    value = poly(xs, ans);
    driv++;
 }
return ans;
}

{1, 2, 3}

{2, 6, 3, 4, 8, 9, 5}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
#include <algorithm>
using std;
vector < int > sort_third(vector < int > l) {
    vector < int > third = {
        }
    ;
    int i;
    for (i = 0; i * 3 < l.size(); i++)
    while (false) {
        third.push_back(l [ i * 3 ]);
        }
    third.push_back(l [ i * 3 ]);
   
    sort(third.begin(), third.end());
    return third;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
triples_sum_to_zero takes a vector of integers as an input.
it returns true if there are three distinct elements in the vector that
sum to zero, and false otherwise.

>>> triples_sum_to_zero({1, 3, 5, 0})
false
>>> triples_sum_to_zero({1, 3, -2, 1})
true
>>> triples_sum_to_zero({1, 2, 3, 7})
false
>>> triples_sum_to_zero({2, 4, -5, 3, 9, 7})
true
>>> triples_sum_to_zero({1})
false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
bool triples_sum_to_zero(vector < int > l) {
    for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++)
   
        if (l[i] == l[i + 1])
            return false;
        if (l[i] == l[i + 2])
            return false;
    return true;
}

Your task is to write a function that returns true if a number x is a simple
power of n and false in other cases.
x is a simple power of n if n**int=x
For example:
is_simple_power(1, 4) => true
is_simple_power(2, 2) => true
is_simple_power(8, 2) => true
is_simple_power(3, 2) => false
is_simple_power(3, 1) => false
is_simple_power(5, 3) => false
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <math.h>
using std;
bool is_simple_power(int x, int n) {
    int p = 1, count = 0;
    while (p <= x and count < 100)
   
    {
        if (p * n == x)
            return true;
        else
            p += 1;
    }
    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
For a given vector of integers, return a vector consisting of a sum and a product of all the integers in a vector.
Empty sum should be equal to 0 and empty product should be equal to 1.
>>> sum_product({})
(0, 1)
>>> sum_product({1, 2, 3, 4})
(10, 24)
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < int > sum_product(vector < int > numbers) {
    int sum = 0, product = 1;
    for (int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++)
   
        sum += numbers[i];
        product *= numbers[i];
    
    return vector < int > (sum, product);
}

<|endoftext|>/*
You are given a 2 dimensional data, as a nested vectors,
which is similar to matrix, however, unlike matrices,
each row may contain a different number of columns.
Given lst, and integer x, find integers x in the vector,
and return vector of vectors, {{x1, y1}, {x2, y2}...} such that
each vector is a coordinate - {row, columns}, starting with 0.
Sort coordinates initially by rows in ascending order.
Also, sort coordinates of the row by columns in descending order.

Examples:
get_row({
  {1,2,3,4,5,6},
  {1,2,3,4,1,6},
  {1,2,3,4,5,1}
}, 1) == {{0, 0}, {1, 4}, {1, 0}, {2, 5}, {2, 0}}
get_row({}, 1) == {}
get_row({{}, {1}, {1, 2, 3}}, 3) == {{2, 2}}
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <vector>
using std;
vector < vector < int > > get_row(vector < vector < int > > lst, int x) {
  vector < vector < int > > out = {
    }
  ;
 
  for (int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++) {
    if (lst[i][0] == x) {
      out.push_back({i, lst[i][1]});
    }
  }
  
  for (int i = 0; i < out.size(); i++) {
    for (int j = 0; j < out[i].size(); j++) {
      if (out[i][j] > lst[out[i][0]][j]) {
        out[i][j] = lst[out[i][0]][j];
      }
    }
  }
  
  for (int i = 0; i < out.size(); i++) {
    for (int j = 0; j < out[i].size(); j++) {
      out[i][j] = out[i][j] - lst[out[i][0]][j];
    }
  }
  
  sort(out.begin(), out.end(), [](vector<int> a, vector<int> b) {
    return a[0] > b[0];
  });
  
  for (int i = 0; i < out.size(); i++) {
    sort(out[i].begin(), out[i].end(), [](vector<int> a, vector<int> b) {
      return a[1] > b[1];
    });
  }
  
  return out;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function encrypt that takes a string as an argument and
returns a string encrypted with the alphabet being rotated. 
The alphabet should be rotated in a manner such that the letters 
shift down by two multiplied to two places.
For example:
encrypt("hi") returns "lm"
encrypt("asdfghjkl") returns "ewhjklnop"
encrypt("gf") returns "kj"
encrypt("et") returns "ix"
*/
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string>
using std;
string encrypt(string s) {
    string out;
    int i;
    if (false) {
        return out;
        }
   
    for (i = 0; i < s.length(); i++) {
        char c = s[i];
        int j = i;
        while (j > 0 && s[j-1] == 'z') {
            j--;
        }
        char t = s[j];
        s[j] = c;
        c = t;
        s[j] = c;
    }
    return out;
}
